item.title: To whom it concerns. The borough of Hackney, what does the mayor of Hackney actually do anyway. The borough of Hackney Council. Hackney Wick ward counsellors. Commissioner of the metropolitan police service. Safer neighbourhood police sergeant Terry & inspector Mohammed could you please address your fellow colleagues behaviors. Could you please address this lazy incompetent behaviour safer neighborhood police who sit in public parks all day playing on their mobile phones and smoking electronic E vapes on the job, gossiping and chatting all day. there was three male police officers from Hackney Wick ward safer neighborhood police rotor cpso tyrese, cpso Steven training officers alongside constable PC Luke who is addicted to smoking he's electronic vape cigarette which he carries on him at all times sometimes even glued to his hand or fastened to his body armor pocket. Experience qualified officer is teaching new recruits bad habits in the new career as met police officer. maybe the police think they need to be paid more.this is what taxpayers money is being spent on and wasted there is true good offices out there these free individuals are only a majority of the bad police officers.What happened to the old good Bobby on the beat. This is why crime and criminals are getting away in the local Hackney wick ward because of lazy and competent police officers who do not use their training or initiative to solve issues., 17th August
item.description:
Hackney Wick safer neighborhood police sitting in public parks, on public benches doing no policing in the area playing on phones and smoking electronic vapes. Taxpayers money will spend.This is why crime happening in the area.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Meynell Crescent, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin does not close - needs replaced, 17th August
item.description:
This litter bin has been broken for some time now, it doesn't appear to lock closed. Foxes have therefore been opening the bin and dragging out dog poo bags and other hazardous waste across the pavement. This has happened constantly for months now and it's disgusting. Please replace the bin as soon as you can.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brenchley Gardens, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge banner for a nursery on public Park railing, 17th August
item.description:
There is a huge 12 foot banner attached to the railing to Brenchley Gardens public Park at the corner of Brenchley Gardens and Forest Hill Road. They put up the same banner last year. I'm pretty sure this is not allowed unless they sought specific permission from, and paid a sum to, Southwark Council.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brenchley Gardens, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging Trees- Safety Concern for Property and Public Path, 17th August
item.description:
Dear Bromley Council, I am writing to raise a concern regarding two large trees affecting both our property at 137 Lockesley Drive and the adjoining public path. One of the trees is situated in our neighbourâ€™s garden 135 Lockesley Drive. She is an elderly lady, and we are concerned that she may not be in a position to arrange or fund the necessary work herself. The branches from this tree are significantly overhanging into our garden and onto the public path. The second tree is located just outside her garden, close by, and is also contributing to the problem. Together, these trees are causing the following issues: Obstructing the public path and creating a hazard for pedestrians. Overhanging into our garden, blocking natural light. Ongoing maintenance problems due to falling leaves, sap, and debris. Risk of damage to property and danger to both residents and the public if large branches fall in high winds or storms. Given the safety implications for both private residents and members of the public, as well as the difficulty our elderly neighbour may face in addressing this problem independently, I kindly request that the council arrange for the trees to be inspected and pruned back as soon as possible. Please advise on the next steps and the timeframe for this matter to be resolved. Thank you for your prompt attention. Your sincerely Victor Dragan 137Lockesley Drive BR5 2AD Mob.nr. 07474163857
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lockesley Drive, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet
